alert.note: Alert for Champaign; McLean; Piatt (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 12:52AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Piatt, central De Witt, southeastern McLean and northwestern Champaign Counties through 130 AM CDT... At 1252 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Colfax to near Clinton. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Colfax around 1255 AM CDT. Weldon around 110 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include De Land, Monticello, Mansfield, Bondville, White Heath and Seymour. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 between mile markers 231 and 257. Interstate 72 between mile markers 168 and 182. Interstate 74 between mile markers 148 and 181. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Lincoln. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for central and east central Illinois.
